isis.stitle: FAN DRIVE CLUTCH: KYSOR 1090 (8000 SERIES) - DISASSEMBLE - SHAFT ASSEMBLY REMOVAL

svcproc.title: SHAFT ASSEMBLY REMOVAL
svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 9for all item numbers in parentheses.

step1.para: Withdraw the shaft assembly (Item 13) from the bearing housing (Item 6). Inspect the surface (A) for signs of wear or brinneling. If found, replace the shaft assembly (Item 13).
Rotate the piston rod (Item 15) and check the bearing. If the bearing is rough, replace piston rod assembly.

If the bearing is okay, DO NOT REMOVE THE PISTON ROD ASSEMBLY FROM THE SHAFT. Clean any dust and debris from the shaft, but do not submerge in solvent. Install new spring (Item 12) and end cap (Item 21) onto piston rod (Item 15). Set shaft assembly (Item 13) aside.
Rotate piston on the bearing housing (Item 6). The bearing should turn smoothly. If not, replace the bearing housing.

Remove grease seal (Item 8) from housing (Item 6). Remove large O-ring (Item 4) from piston. Clean dust and debris from housing (Item 6) but do not submerge in solvent. Inspect lining surface inside housing (Item 6) for cracks, scoring or burning. If found, replace housing (Item 6). Using a lint free rag, remove old grease from needle bearings inside housing (Item 6). USE NO SOLVENT. Lightly lubricate needle bearing with recommended grease. Refer to LUBRICANTS. Install new grease seal (Item 8) in housing. Clean old grease from spring steel dust seal (5). Inspect seal, replace only if pieces are missing. Lubricate dust seal (Item 5) with recommended grease. Lubricate new O-ring (Item 14) with recommended grease and install on piston.
